ud1.5:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud1.5:1.3: Now at that time a number of senior monks approached the Buddha—Venerables Sāriputta, Mahāmoggallāna, Mahākassapa, Mahākaccāna, Mahākoṭṭhita, Mahākappina, Mahācunda, Anuruddha, Revata, and Nanda.
ud1.5:2.1: The Buddha saw them coming off in the distance,
ud1.5:2.5: When he said this, a certain mendicant of the brahmin caste asked the Buddha,
ud1.5:2.6: “Sir, how do you define a brahmin? And what are the things that make one a brahmin?”
ud1.5:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud1.5:4.4: they are the world’s true brahmins.”
